column2: IDAHO DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Idaho
column6: ID

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: be ready to stop.
column6: look for a train.
column8: slow down.

column2: 2. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Alcohol does not
column8: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 3. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Yield.
column6: NO TURN ON RED.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 4. Approximately one-half of all motorcycle crashes:
column4: are minor crashes with no injuries.
column6: involve motorcyclists riding in a staggered formation.
column8: involve another vehicle.

column2: 5. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 6. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: School ahead.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: Regulatory.

column2: 7. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: No U-Turn
column6: No right turn
column8: No parking

column2: 9. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: has the right-of-way.

column2: 10. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: On slippery roads.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 11. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 12. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the driver
column6: both
column8: whoever is slower

column2: 13. When coming to a place where you cannot see what is ahead - like a steep hill or a sharp curve, you should:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: give your horn a light tap, proceed slowly and stay close to the right edge of the road.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait until visibility improves.
column10: speed up to increase your visibility quickly.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Yield
column6: No left turn
column8: No parking

column2: 15. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you can reduce fuel consumption.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 16. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Stop.
column6: Turn off the ignition.
column8: Yield.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column6: Detour to the right
column8: Not enter
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 18. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column6: keep your eyes moving.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 19. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.
column8: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.

column2: 20. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.

column2: 21. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: On the right curb.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 23. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column6: they already are within the intersection.
column8: they are turning right.

column2: 24. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Pennant
column8: Triangle

column2: 25. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Rely on your mirrors.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 26. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: has no effect, they are different substances.
column6: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column8: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column10: reduces the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 27. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: tailgating.
column6: closetailing.
column8: aggressive driving.

column2: 28. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 29. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Yield.
column6: Construction and maintenance warning.
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 30. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column6: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column8: stop in the right lane.
column10: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column6: Merge
column8: Do not block intersection
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 32. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: U-turns are not allowed.

column2: 33. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Stop ahead
column6: Buggy warning
column8: Tow away zone

column2: 35. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Drink coffee before driving.
column6: Take a cold shower before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 36. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 37. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: brown and white.
column6: black and white.
column8: black and orange.

column2: 38. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: call a taxi if you've been drinking.

column2: 39. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: The divided highway ends ahead.
column8: Divided highway ahead.

column2: 40. If you see a pedestrian using a guide dog or carrying a white cane:
column4: sound your horn to warn them.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to them.
column8: you must stop and give them directions.
column10: the pedestrian must yield the right-of-way.
